page.title: 04BOMBING RANGES
page.content: A LARGE AREA OF THE BEACH IN THE BLOCK IS TAKEN UP BY AN RAF BOMBING AND STRAFFING RANGE. IT IS USED FOUR DAYS A WEEK BY THE RAF AND THE USAF. AIRCRAFT COME FROM MAINLAND EUROPE AS WELL AS FROM STATIONS IN BRITAIN.THERE ARE STRAFFING TARGETS WHICH ARE NO MORE THAN SACKING SHEETS ON METAL FRAMES. THERE ARE TWO BOMBING TARGETS: ONE IS AT THE CENTRE OF A 50M CIRCLE OF RED AND WHITE PAINTED OIL DRUMS. THE OTHER IS A FLOATING TARGET. THE RANGE IS CONTROLLED FROM A TOWER MANNED BY RAF PERSONEL AT DONNA NOOK ITSELF (SITE OF AN OLD LIFEBOAT STATION AND PROBABLY NAMED AFTER A SUNKEN SPANISH GALLEON).THERE ARE THREE 'QUADS' ALSO. THESE ARE HUTS IN WIRE NETTING ENCLOSURES FROM WHICH THE BOMB DETONATIONS CAN BE ACCURATELY FIXED BY TRIANGULATION.ON THURSDAYS THE RANGE IS USED TO TEST FIELD GUNS.
